TopicTitle: What the hell happened to the keyboard commands.

Articles.Content: Someone please tell me how to reset the keyboard back to the way it should be. What the hell? I'm staging while in docking mode? And now I have to move my hand to the other side of the keyboard to switch between rotation and translation? Seriously???? What was the point in making a mess out of the keyboard Squad? I can't even dock any more.
Also, "F" for clamber and "B" for board, what a mess...

> 
> Also, "F" for clamber and "B" for board, what a mess...

Well, be glad I crashed into my station while using the 'new and improved' keyboard BEFORE I went EVA otherwise I'd be raging about that too...

This reminds me of another game where their graphic artists completely repainted every single icon in the game for no damned good reason other than job security.
Check your key bindings for docking mode. According to the devnotes, it's now an alternate complete set of key bindings.

> 
> Also, "F" for clamber and "B" for board, what a mess...

You might be the biggest nay-sayer I have ever stumbled upon. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The docking mode in stagin mode doesn't seem to do anything for me, I think its a bug. It happens to me whenever I stage rapidly, I get the onscreen text "LinRot set to Somethingorother" I don't remember exactly what it was. It didn't seem to change anything.

Can you not re-map thise controls BACK to the way they used to be?

> 
> Check your key bindings for docking mode. According to the devnotes, it's now an alternate complete set of key bindings.

Yea, I did check, Since switching between ROT and TRANS appears to do nothing now except stage, here's what I have to do. Use my right hand to see where I'm going with the mouse. To rotate, I have to put my left hand on ASDF. To translate, I have to put my left hand on HJKL. What kind of freaking sense is that? There was nothing wrong with the old system.

And if they can be remapped back to the old way, it's not working as expected. I set it to NOT stage when I hit the space and it did it anyway.
